com.enaikoon.android.gps.core

Class GPSService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.BaseService
      • com.enaikoon.android.gps.core.GPSService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.ActivityNewIntentListener, com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.ActivityOnPauseListener, com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.ActivityOnResumeListener, com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.ActivityResultListener

    public class GPSService
extends com.enaikoon.android.service.baseservice.BaseService
    Provides GPS data and listeners.

    This class provides access to the system GPS location services.

    This class allows you to get GPS location changes, GPS status changes, provider enabled/disabled change and filtered GPS locations.

    If you need are callback to be invoked when location is changed, you need call setOnLocationChanged(LocationChanged) with param your listener.
    Example: 
      
 gpsService.setOnLocationChanged(new LocationChanged()
        public void onLocationChanged(Location location) {
                ... 
        }
 });
    If you need are callback to be invoked when status is changed, you need call setOnStatusChanged(GPSStatusChanged) with param your listener.
    Example: 
      
 gpsService.setOnStatusChanged(new GPSStatusChanged() {
        public void onStatusChanged(String s, int i, Bundle bundle) {
                ...
        }
 });
    If you need are callback to be invoked when GPS provider is changed, you need call setProviderListener(GPSProvider) with param your listener.
    Example: 
     
 gpsService.setProviderListener(new GPSProvider() {
        public void onProviderEnabled(String s) {
                ...
        }
 
        public void onProviderDisabled(String s) {
                ...
        }
 });
    If you want to receive only filtered location data, you should call setOnValidLocationChanged(ValidLocationChanged) with a implementation of your listener. 
     
 gpsService.setOnValidLocationChanged(new ValidLocationChanged() {
        onValidLocationChanged(Location location) {
                ...
        }
 });
    Author:
    enaikoon

      • setOnValidLocationChanged

        public void setOnValidLocationChanged(ValidLocationChanged listener)
        Register a callback to be invoked when a new valid location is received.

        A new location is validated against the previous valid location found, and the event is launched only if the new location is valid

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener.

      • validateGPSData

        public boolean validateGPSData(Location lastValidLocation,
                      Location newLocation,
                      int fix,
                      double HDOP,
                      double VDOP,
                      boolean strictCheck)
        Validates a GPS location signal
        Parameters:
        lastValidLocation - - the last valid location against which the new location has to be checked
        newLocation - - new location which should be checked
        fix - - the number of used satellites
        HDOP - - HDOP value from NMEA parser
        VDOP - - VDOP value from NMEA parser
        strictCheck - - some values will be checked more strictly - Accuracy: lower than 20m - DOP (Diluition of Precision) must be low - Signal has to refer to minimum of 4 satellites to be valid
        Returns:
        true if all checks are valid, false otherwise

      • setStrictCheck

        public void setStrictCheck(boolean strict)
        Toggles strict checking
        Parameters:
        strict - true to enable strict checking, false to disable
